Characteristics: Mure proved Trad., which belongs to a genus of lily-like plants. It produced disorder of the genito-urinary organs, urethral discharge, and inflammation of the scrotum; also embarrassed breathing.
Head: Vertigo.
Urinary Organs: Urine: acid smelling; yellowish, copious, ash-coloured sediment.
Respiratory Organs: Breathing: very painful; embarrassed, difficult, sighing, as from want of air.
Chest: Pain in l. side of chest.
